turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: How'd you know?  Just tell me that. How'd you fucking know?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I knew the same way in ten years you're going to know.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It means that I'm going to tell you things, even though I already know that you're not going to listen to a God damned thing I say.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Listen to me, Bain.  Two days ago, you contacted your contractor, who told you that they knew when and where I was going to pick up the transferred money from MicroCell. You don't know how they got the information.  It bothered you, but you didn't care.  How do I know this?  Because ten years ago, I was sitting in that chair, as scared shitless as you are now.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Yeah you are and you hate it.  You hate the fact that your hand is shaking and mine isn't.  That you're sweating your balls off and I'm not. You've got fear and hate in your belly like battery acid, all because of me.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: If you think you can take me, quit fucking bullshitting and try it.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: All right, Bain.  Pay attention, because this is where everything changes.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: Shit.  That sure is a lot of money.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Did you see how I did that?  Magic wasn't it?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: You understand what's going on?  It makes sense, right?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: What I just said, no assassin would say.  What I've said, only a mark would say.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: You think I would be an idiot to pass up five million dollars.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: You don't know a fucking thing about me.  You don't have the slightest fucking clue.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: I'll tell you this.  After Cleveland, I thought I was lucky to be alive.  But now, here, I just realized that you were the lucky one.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Now I'll tell you something.  It wouldn't fucking matter if I offered you one hundred million dollars. You'd still be thinking the same thing, that you're going to take me. And here I am, sitting through this, knowing it's bullshit, looking at you and the only thing going on in my mind, the only thing I can think is that, in just a few minutes I'm going to take you.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: No.  No.  No.  I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: CONTRACTOR/SCREEN
turns.text: They money will be standard bank transfer.  We believe we will know where and when.

turns.speaker: CONTRACTOR/SCREEN
turns.text: Such language in front of a lady.

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: I don't give a fuck what you are.  I asked you --

turns.speaker: BAIN
turns.text: How in the fuck do you know that?

turns.speaker: CONTRACTOR/SCREEN
turns.text: Do you want Rath or not?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Hi.  Up ahead my boss is in that black limo.  We're not sure which hotel we're at, so could you just follow them?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Good afternoon.  We have reservations at the Hotel Paraiso in Costa Blanca.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No, no.  I said the Hotel Paraiso.

turns.speaker: CABBY
turns.text: Yes.  This is the Hotel Paraiso.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No, the other Hotel Paraiso, in the city.  Near the Plaza del Sol.

turns.speaker: CABBY
turns.text: I'm sorry, sir.  A year ago there was a fire in the old Hotel Paraiso. This is the new Hotel Paraiso.

turns.speaker: RATH/SCREEN
turns.text: Send the file.  I'll have the estimate tonight.

turns.speaker: CONTRACTOR/SCREEN
turns.text: A new player.  He's using the name Nicholai.

turns.speaker: RATH/SCREEN
turns.text: The fucking contract!  How in the fuck did he know.

turns.speaker: RATH/SCREEN
turns.text: I don't know what the fuck you are.

turns.speaker: CONTRACTOR/SCREEN
turns.text: I know.  It was a joke.

turns.speaker: CONTRACTOR/SCREEN
turns.text: Tomorrow.  The buyer is Japanese. His retirement a condition of the bonus.

turns.speaker: CONTRACTOR/SCREEN
turns.text: I have been sitting on a contract from Cleveland for six days because of you.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Fuck you, fuck Cleveland, and fuck your contracts --

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I give a fuck?  I'm done!  I quit! Do you fucking hear me!  I'm fucking gone!

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Is this how it went, Nick?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: You think this is a fucking joke?

turns.speaker: CONTRACTOR/SCREEN
turns.text: We have an M.O... Her system is protected by her 'pussy virus.'

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He has to clean up.  How many bodies were there?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Nikita?  She helped me find you.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: What?  How did you know I had a cat?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Took a guess.  Lucky for you, I guessed right.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Who the fuck are you?  Who do you work for?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You're one of them, aren't you?  A fucking pro.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I'm part of the game, just like you.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: What do you mean, 'that's all'? What in the hell do you know?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: The bonus on the contract for you was one million dollars.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I figure that means these are worth ten times that, maybe more.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Now you understand why I'm here.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No, stay in the car.  I want you to understand something.  If I intended to kill you, you would already be dead.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Okay.  How did you find me?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: You're the computer hacker, you tell me.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You didn't know anything about me.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Yellow Pages.  V for veterinarian. There aren't that many.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You're one of them, aren't you?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: If I still was what I used to be, you would not be pointing that at me.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No.  They hired Bain.  The contract would have been mine, but Bain took it from me as he took the previous one.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: So this is something between you and him?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He stole the contract knowing that I would come after him.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Because he is trying to retire me.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: The nature of the business.  You remove your competition.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: And you want to use me to get him?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Don't tell me I don't have a choice!

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I'm two seconds away from making my choice which means you've got two seconds to tell me why I shouldn't shoot you.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It's simple.  You need me.  I need you.  And we will both need money.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I don't need you to get the money -- my money!

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: If it hadn't been for me, you would be dead.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: This is something that is never going to end.  You can never work in the business again with this contract, because he will find you. To survive, you have to go into deep hiding.  And that's going to take money, a lot of money.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Then you can have the disks and I'll just walk out that door --

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: If you walk out that door, Bain will still come after you.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Because he took a contract on you. He'll come for you and he'll find you.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You don't know that -- you're trying to scare me.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No.  It's the truth.  I know what you are.  Like me, like Bain, you're a ghost, you're not part of the real world.  You don't have a social security number.  You don't pay taxes.  You've probably used ten different names over the last ten years.  A long time ago something probably happened, something illegal and you ran, you disappeared and it was easy.  You think you can do it again.  But I'm telling you, fading from the law is nothing.  No matter what you do, where you go, I swear to you that Bain will find you.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Right now, as we sit here, he is tearing through your apartment.  He is digging through your drawers, emptying your closets.  He will take your telephone and address books, your appointment books.  If you keep a diary, he is reading it.  He'll go into the kitchen and find out what kind of food you eat, liquor you drink, cigarettes you smoke.  In the bathroom he will find any prescription drugs you take and where you get them filled.  If you have video tape or recordings he will watch and listen to all of them.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He will know everything about you. Everything.  I know, because I've done it.  Once you've been inside a mark's home, you're in their head. If you're any good, you'll find the mark in a week, and Bain is good because I was the best and I couldn't take him.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Listen -- I don't even know your name.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: What I'm trying to say is that -- I'm not sure I can do this, help you, unless I know more about you.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: What do you want to know?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: If Bain hadn't taken the contract on me, would you have?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: This is crazy.  I can't trust you. You can't trust me.  How can we possibly help each other?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It's not the same, is it?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He was Russian.  Nicholai Tachlinkov.  A legend in the business when I was just starting. I admired him.  When I heard he loved chess I became obsessed with the game.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: We played with a code using <u>The New</u> <u>York Times</u> obituaries.  Over three years we played twelve matches.  I never won.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Why didn't you finish this game?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Because that's how it works.  That's what it's about.  He was the best. He was on top.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Yes.  As soon as you get into this business, all you can think about is getting to the top.  That's all there is.  Until then, there is nothing.  You are nothing.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: How did you get into the business?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: The same way everyone does; the government, the Agency.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: They recruited me when I was in high school.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Languages.  I was already fluent in nine languages.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You were like a boy genius?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Some people said that.  I never thought so.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You went from high school to the Agency?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No.  I graduated from George Washington University.  Then I entered the Agency training program.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: They didn't give you a choice, did they?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: But you knew what they were training you for?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Of course.  I was going to be James Bond.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: They are very good at what they do. It's very seductive.  The training, the weapons, the travel --

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Women... I don't... I don't want to talk about women.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Why did you leave the Agency?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: The same reason everyone does.  You hear your name on C-SPAN and you realize you're a skeleton in someone's closet and they're coming to bury you.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Yes.  It didn't matter much to them as long as I disappeared.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: The only thing different about the private sector is that a General Contractor takes less of a percentage than the government, so you make more money.  Then once you make the transition, you realize you were never working for the government; it was always the private sector, the vested interests and it's the same vested interests that continue to buy your plane tickets.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Tell me about the first time.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It was... mechanical.  Very precise. It was exactly like the training drill except for the adrenaline.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Did it ever bother James Bond?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: This is fiction!  Don't you see that?  This is another reality.  And the people that come into the world to play this game -- nobody forces them!  They're here, they know the rules, the stakes, the risks!  Do you understand what I am saying?  No one is innocent -- including you!

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Does that mean it didn't bother you?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Is that what you wanted to hear? Something cold blooded... something remorseless...

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It.  Tell it.  For all I know it could be a machine.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You said you didn't trust it.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I've never been to the Gulf of Mexico.  Is it as nice as they say?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I wasn't expecting this.  I need to think.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It helps me to focus.  It centers me, helps me think.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Oh.  What do you think about?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Work.  The things I need to get done.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Do you think about the game?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: But you've never figured out a way to win.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: What will you do if this works, if we get the money?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I don't know... maybe I'll live on a boat, sail to all the places I've never been.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I'm kind of tired.  I think I'd like to try and get some sleep.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: You can have the bed.  The chair is fine for me.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: What do you think he's doing?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I don't know... But I'm sure he's not sleeping.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Why don't you bring it out here? It's beautiful out here.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I know what you are thinking.  I'm not going to disappear, okay?  I'm not going anywhere, just down there, to that beautiful beach.  I got to get out of this room, just for a little while.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He won't be looking for you.  Just be careful.  Buy a book.  Keep your sunglasses on.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Not that I would know, but you look like you're really good at it.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I've always wanted to learn something like that.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: You should.  It's very important, that the body release the energy that builds in it.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I paid a lot for these.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: They saw you coming a mile away.  If I had known we'd be using --

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It's too late now.  Okay?  We'll have to deal with these.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: This is the bank.  This is the hotel.  In the morning I will enter the bank.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He will be hidden somewhere out here, probably somewhere low, in the crowd.  He'll stay there until he sees me enter the bank.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: But he won't shoot you right then?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No.  It would be amateur.  A risk. He'll wait for the prime shot, that he knows is coming.  Once I'm inside, he'll move to the hotel. He'll go up the back, too much traffic in the front.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: You'll be here.  A restaurant.  A public place far enough away that he won't notice you, but with a good enough view you'll be able to see him when he moves inside.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Aiiee.  More waiting?  I don't know if I like this plan.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It will take the entire day, but he will begin to doubt himself.  He will begin to believe that he missed me, that somehow I slipped by and am already on a plane to Europe.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: The sun will be low, almost dark, the air cool and the bank will almost be closed.  5:45.  5:50.  He will put the rifle down, he will get up and he will walk across the plaza to the bank.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Why won't he wait until the bank closes?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He won't be able to.  He'll have to go inside.  He'll have to see with his own eyes, whether or not I am there.  If the bank closes, he won't know for sure.  He'll come.  I'm sure.  And when he does you'll go into the hotel, go upstairs and take the gun.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: What?  What if he brings it with him?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He can't.  The bank has an expensive security system; metal detectors and X-ray machines.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: That means you won't have a gun.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: And with the mikes, I'll tell you when he leaves the hotel and you'll tell me when he leaves the bank.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: If things go well, I don't have to. You'll already be in a rented car waiting for me.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You'll have the money.  How do I know that you won't --

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I'll be walking out of the bank, unarmed.  You'll have the gun and I'll drive the car.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Five million apiece.  You get on your plane, I get on mine.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I've been thinking about it for a long time.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Except, if he doesn't come out of the hotel.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You can't know for sure, how can you?  I mean, you're not him.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Ten years ago, I sat there in that same hotel window, sweat pouring off of me waiting --

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: You killed him here?  In this city, outside that bank?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: What is it?  I don't like this at all.  What is going on here?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I don't know.  It just happened.  I was here ten years ago, I'm here now.  That's it.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It wasn't planned or premeditated. I swear.  Things happened beyond my control.  I understood; I saw where they were leading and I suppose that it just made sense.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I waited until I was insane and then I walked into the bank.  He was sitting there, very calm, waiting for me.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He wanted what I want now; to get out of the business.  To disappear to some empty Greek island.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He said I couldn't win.  That no one wins at this game.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Then he offered me one million dollars to walk away, to quit the business.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No.  I went back to the hotel.  And waited.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Ten years later, here you are again.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I think I got one today.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Five million dollars will buy a lot of Rolaids.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Why did you trade a bishop for a knight?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I hate bishops.  They're useless.  I like knights.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Did you think they were newlyweds?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: When I first saw them I thought they were married.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: How do you know they're not?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I went into their room this afternoon.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: It was no big deal.  I saw them leave, I went in.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Why in the hell would you take that chance?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I heard them last night and it made me want to know something about them.  I wanted to, so I did.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: She is married, but not to him. Another man, much older.  She has four kids.  The young guy works for her.  And I think she likes kinky sex.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Isn't it interesting though?  I mean, look at us, in this room.  Or yesterday, when we were walking in the plaza market.  I mean, we look like just another couple.  But what are we?  Doesn't it seem so crazy?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: It's always been that way.  The world has always functioned on two levels.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I know.  It makes me crazy.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I don't know.  When I was in college, I was forced to go to a psychiatrist because I was caught drilling holes in my dorm room floor.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: And you were drilling these holes...?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: So I could watch the girl that lived under me.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Apparently this doctor was unable to cure you.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: He told me that my curiosity became unnaturally entangled with my sense of self-preservation.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Did he explain how this happened?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: He believed it all went back to one night, when as a little girl.  I watched my parents have this big fight, really big.  I thought my mother was going to kill my father. Then they went into their room and made up.  And I watched them make love through the keyhole.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I'm playing white, remember.  You can't tell me which pieces to move. It doesn't work that way.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Is it a physical thing, or a mental thing?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Is that why you didn't want to talk about women before?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I didn't want to complicate the situation.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Someone like me, like you.  A pro.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: No.  I tried to stop it.  I couldn't.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: After her, I realized that to survive I had to live without... It's dangerous to let things become complicated.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I'm not sure that I care anymore.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Were you attracted to me right away?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: When I gave you my gun and you almost shot me.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Maybe you should see a psychiatrist.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I know.  That's why I'm attracted to you.  I mean, you make me nervous. You're intimidating.  Maybe it's my curiosity/self-preservation thing, but all I can really think about right now is kissing you.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Wait until he is on the stairs.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: He's coming, Electra!  Get out now!

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: The point is, they are paying for information.  Real information.  Not tooth paste brands.  Not whether he wads of folds his toilet paper.  And no 16 hours of recorded phone sex. You are wasting everyone's time with this shit.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: God damnit, Electra.  This is not a game.  This is business.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: Right.  In my hands I have five back-up disks he made of all of his work last night.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Jesus!  Why didn't you tell me?

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: I'll make my usual arrangements and expect my usual bonus.

turns.speaker: ELECTRA
turns.text: A pleasure doing business with you.

turns.speaker: ESCORT
turns.text: How can a beautiful man like you be shy?

turns.speaker: ESCORT
turns.text: I'd love one.  Whatever you're having.

turns.speaker: ESCORT
turns.text: Holidays are our busiest days.  No one likes to be alone on holidays. I know I don't.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: You're very good at this aren't you?

turns.speaker: ESCORT
turns.text: I think you're supposed to answer that question.

turns.speaker: ESCORT
turns.text: That's okay, hon, I always expect the unexpected.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: I called because I just want... I need to talk.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Do you ever regret things you've done?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: But when you finLsh a job, afterwards do you think about them?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Do you think about their wives or their families?

turns.speaker: ESCORT
turns.text: No.  They call me, I don't call them.  If they didn't call I wouldn't exist.

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Do you ever think about starting over?

turns.speaker: RATH
turns.text: Can you tell me about it?

turns.speaker: ESCORT
turns.text: Are you asking me if I believe in another life?
